intro: Quercus sontraensis, commonly known as the Sontra oak, is a species of flowering plant in the beech family, Fagaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, specifically in parts of Mexico and Guatemala. This deciduous tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, with a broad, spreading crown and thick, leathery leaves. Its acorns are enclosed in a cupule and are an important food source for various wildlife species. The tree is adapted to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in cloud forests at elevations between 1,000 and 2,500 meters.
